intro: Trichodiadema bulbosum, commonly known as the Cape snowball, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It features a compact, rounded shape with thick, fleshy leaves that store water, allowing it to thrive in arid conditions. The plant produces clusters of white, star-shaped flowers during the winter months. Its foliage is typically green with a slightly powdery coating, and it has a shallow root system. It is well-suited for rock gardens and xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental appeal.
